Class MouseStatus

java.lang.Object
userInterface.backEnd.MouseStatus
public class MouseStatus extends Object
Tracks the current mouse interaction status used by the back-end viewer.

This lightweight state holder exposes a simple API to:

  • initialize the mouse status (defaults to ViewerStatus.IDLE),
  • toggle between ViewerStatus.IDLE and ViewerStatus.EXECUTION,
  • explicitly set a given ViewerStatus, and
  • retrieve the current status.
It is typically referenced by UI components to decide how mouse events should be interpreted (e.g., idle vs. execution timeline interactions).
Author:
ShiuJia
